Key Match Events: Brad Evans c Afif Hossain b Mosaddek Hossain 2 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 100
Richard Ngarava st †Nurul Hasan b Mosaddek Hossain 6 (3b 0x4 1x6 6m) SR: 200
Pre-Game Insights: Shakib's men are under pressure while Ervine's are eyeing an unlikely tilt at a semi-final spot
Moody: Zimbabwe going into the contest as a real threat
Zimbabwe have grown to be a fighting side in the last few years, culminating in their ODI and T20I series wins over Bangladesh in July 2022
Zimbabwe's form is as good as their fighting spirit, and the way they defended the 130 against Pakistan was proof
Bangladesh, meanwhile, are back in trouble in T20Is
And so, two old rivals meet for the first time in a T20 World Cup with the tables turned
Shakib Al Hasan's bowling form is a concern
Miscellaneous Highlights: Teams batting first have won four out of the six T20Is in Brisbane, with 168 being the average first-innings score
No problems on the weather front on match day
In July, Zimbabwe beat Bangladesh in a T20I series for the first time
Raza has won three Player-of-the-Match awards during this T20 World Cup, after not winning any in the 2014 and 2016 editions
Zimbabwe had lost 15 T20Is in a row against Pakistan, but won two out of their last three encounters
Others: Bangladesh technical consultant Sridharan Sriram, when asked how his side will stop Zimbabwe: 'I don't think I need to tell you but we definitely have a plan. I think we respect Zimbabwe, they had an amazing performance against Pakistan. I watched every ball of it. The way they pulled it off against Pakistan was unbelievable. Full credit to them, full respect.'
